messageBody:
panna943k wrote:
> I've just started with Junit and I'm now trying to develop my first
> application with TDD.
> This application should become a Servlet based web-shop but to keep
> the things simple I develop the base classes as command line
> application.
> The data classes like catalog or article are easily developed but now
> I'm stumbling on the flow.
> When a user is logged in he should see the first page of the catalog.
> This is easily tested but the catalog has a reference to the pages and
> those to the articles of each page.
> Should I set all the values in the test class like
> Article firstarticle = new Article(1);
> Artcle secondArticle = new Article(2);
> Page onePage = new Page(1);
> Catalog onecatalog = new Catalg("2005));
> onepage.addArticle(firstarticle);
> onepage.addArticle(secondarticle);
> onecatalog.addPage(onePage);
> Workflow oneworkflow = new Workflow();
>
> So I've got two questions? Should I set all the values in the test
> class? How do I model a workflow?
> I prefer not to user mock objects because I've found it for my
> knowledge level confusing.

If you need this object graph in order to write your test, then create
the object graph. Sometimes creating big object graphs becomes difficult
to maintain. Use Google to searh for "ObjectMother", which is one
technique for organizing code that creates objects used in test cases.
